0chan is certainly the most attractive, but it might use some redesign (I don't mean it in the HTML5 sense, just that users should be able to create a threads on their own, and reply slightly quicker). 

..But then, how will people take care of the spammers? This is puzzling.

1_15JNF8bdyG4zEWVASsgbkFirzM6gyYpSBA.body:
> [chinabiz](#comment_30_1DWrKbEomgBLHjczm1HkP556Vg68ewDmyd): Surespot, yes, but you don't receive new message notifications because they've removed the GCM components.I don't think Signal is available on f-droid.Conversations is available on f-droid.


This probably wouldn't sound appealing to the type of users who use 0net, but you might use the open-source replacement for the proprietary google framework microG. You can use apps which rely on the Play Services and GCM with slightly more privacy* (*I'm not implying it's 100% private, but it sure as hell is better privacy-wise). 

Or you could just avoid using Google services at all, but then, you're severely limiting your phone's capabilities.
